info.title: BaaS Pix Payment
info.description:
Api responsible for managing pix payments, for debit (payment or return) and credit operations

To see how the payment flow is going, the client can get information about it and confirm the statuses and occurrences.

| Status                | Description                                                 |
|-------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------|
| `CREATED` | Successfully created |
| `CONFIRMING` | Sent for internal confirmation |
| `CONFIRMED` | Confirmed by client |
| `NOT_CONFIRMED` | Not confirmed by client |
| `PROCESSING` | Sent for internal processing |
| `PROCESSED` | Successfully processed |
| `REJECTED` | Pix has been rejected (final) |
| `ERROR` | Some error has occurred (final) |
| `DONE` | Pix has been successfully completed (final) |
| `VALIDATING` | Credit order sent to client validation |
| `VALID` | Credit order was successfully validated by client |

## Payment Confirmation Call - Credit Order

In order to receive a credit, a prior confirmation is required.

To receive the validation request, its necessary the previous registration of the client url.

- Add a valid url to **pix-credit-order-validation-url** configuration linked to the **application-id**

This object will be sent as a HTTP call with the POST method.

### Request schema

#### *Header*
```json
{
  X-R4-Application: GUID, // Application Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Delivery: GUID, // Unique Payment Identifier
  X-R4-Event: pix_credit_order_validation,
  User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
}
```

#### *Body*
```json
{
  "object_kind": pix_credit_order_validation,
  "object_id": "GUID", // Unique Payment Identifier
  "application_id": "GUID", // Application Unique Identifier
  "key": "56856854748", // Pix key - Provided only if not a MANUAL payment
  "original_end_to_end_id": "E0435879820200123221500000000001, // Provided for payment return only
  "metadata": {
    "id": // Unique Payment Identifier,
    "value": 185.99,
    "goal": "BUY_OR_TRANSFER", // CHANGE | WITHDRAW | BUY_OR_TRANSFER
    "payer": {
      "name": "Payer Name",
      "agency": 1,
      "account_number": 1234567,
      "account_digit": 7,
      "account_type": "PAYMENT_ACCOUNT",
      "document_type": "CPF",
      "document_number": 15485625874
    },
    "recipient": {
      "account_id": "GUID", // Unique Recipient Account Identifier
      "document_number": 28989915031
    }
  }
}
```

### Response schema

#### *Success - 200*
```json
{
  "operation_validated_at": "2020-01-23T22:10:05.025Z" // [REQUIRED] yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ss.sssZ
}
```

#### *Error - 400*
```json
{
  "operation_validated_at": "2020-01-23T22:10:05.025Z", // [REQUIRED] yyyy-mm-ddTHH:mm:ss.sssZ
  "reason": "RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND_OR_INVALID", // [REQUIRED] REASON enum
  "description": "Recipient account is invalid or was not found" // [OPTIONAL] (additional error description)
}
```

Available **reason** response values:

| Reason              | Description                                                 |
|-------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------|
| `RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_BLOCKED` | The specified transactional account is blocked |
| `RECIPIENT_ACCOUNT_VALUE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` | Payment/return order in an amount that exceeds the limit allowed for the type of transactional account credited |
| `RECIPIENT_DOCUMENT_NUMBER_DIFFERS_FROM_ACCOUNT` | CPF/CNPJ of the receiving user is not consistent with the specified transactional account holder |
| `RECIPIENT_DOCUMENT_NUMBER_INVALID` | Incorrect recipient user's CPF/CNPJ |

## Payment Confirmation Call - Debit Order

In order to perform a pix payment or return, a prior confirmation is required.

To receive the confirmation, its necessary the previous registration of the client url.

- Add a valid url to **pix-confirmation-url** configuration linked to the **application-id**

This object will be sent as a HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 202 status and within 10 seconds.

### Confirmation scheme

#### *Header*
```json
{
  X-R4-Application: GUID, // Application Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Delivery: GUID, // Payment Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Event: pix_payment_confirmation,
  User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
}
```

#### *Body*
```json
{
  "object_kind": "pix_payment_confirmation",
  "object_id": "GUID", // Payment Unique Identifier
  "application_id": "GUID", // Application Unique Identifier
  "account_id": "GUID", // Account Unique Identifier
  "original_end_to_end_id": "GUID", // Original Payment Unique Identifier (applied in case of return)
  "metadata": {
    "id": "GUID", // Payment Unique Identifier
    "value": 100,
    "goal": "BUY_OR_TRANSFER",
    "payer": {
      "name": "Payer Name",
      "bank_code": 88,
      "agency": 1,
      "account": 7654321,
      "account_digit": 1,
      "account_type": "PAYMENT_ACCOUNT",
      "document_type": "CPF",
      "document_number": 67363912025
    },
    "recipient": {
      "name": "Recipient Name",
      "bank_code": 88,
      "agency": 1,
      "account": 1234567,
      "account_digit": 1,
      "account_type": "PAYMENT_ACCOUNT",
      "document_type": "CPF",
      "document_number": 38623009002
    }
  }
}
```

## Status Change Notification

Some statuses changes will fire a notification call to the client.

To receive this notifications, its necessary to request the registration of the service URL which will receive the notification object.

This object will be sent as a HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 200 status and within 5 seconds.

| Event Type          | Pix Status     |
|-------------------- | -------------- |
| `pix_created` | CREATED |
| `pix_confirmed` | CONFIRMED |
| `pix_not_confirmed` | NOT_CONFIRMED |
| `pix_rejected` | REJECTED |
| `pix_error` | ERROR |
| `pix_done` | DONE |

### Notification Call Scheme

#### *Header*
```json
{
  X-R4-Application: GUID, // Application Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Delivery: GUID, // Attempt Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Event: {event_type}, // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table)
  User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
}
```

#### *Body*
```
{
  "object_kind": "{event_type}", // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table)
  "object_id": "GUID", // Payment Unique Identifier
  "account_id": "GUID" // Account Unique Identifier
  "application_id": "GUID" // Application Unique Identifier
}
```

## Errors

This API uses HTTP response status codes to indicate the success or failure of your API requests. In general, there are three status code ranges you can expect:

- `2xx` success status codes confirm that your request worked as expected

- `4xx` error status codes indicate an error because of the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was not provided)

- `5xx` error status codes are rare and indicate an error with R4's servers

### Error codes

Below is a list of possible error codes that can be returned:

| Code                | Description                                                 |
|-------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------|
| `ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND` | Account not found |
| `APPLICATION_PRODUCT_NOT_FOUND` | Product not found for given application id |
| `AUTHENTICATION_FAILED` | Authentication failed |
| `INVALID_DATA` | The data provided has an invalid format |
| `INVALID_DOCUMENT` | Invalid document number |
| `INVALID_PAYMENT_VALUE` | Payment value is not valid |
| `INVALID_UUID` | The provided UUID is not valid |
| `MISSING_PRODUCT_PERMISSION` | Missing product permission |
| `PAYMENT_ALREADY_EXISTS` | Payment already exists |
| `PAYMENT_ALREADY_RETURNED` | The payment has already been returned |
| `PAYMENT_IS_NOT_A_CREDIT` | It is not possible to return a debit |
| `PAYMENT_NOT_FOUND` | Payment not found |
| `PRODUCT_DISABLED` | Product is not enabled |
| `PROFILE_NOT_FOUND` | Profile not found |
| `UNAUTHORIZED` | Unauthorized |
| `UNEXPECTED_ERROR` | Unexpected error with our service |
| `VALIDATION_FAILED` | Invalid request data |

schema.description: Describes the properties of pix payment.

document_payment_initiator.description:
The CNPJ of the payment initiator institution.

* This field is required when the kind property to be equal PAYMENT_TRANSACTION_SERVICE.

kind.description: The type of mechanism used to start the payment

payment_priority.description:
The property indicate if the liquidation is priority or not.

* `IMMEDIATE`: Must be used when the payer user request the send immediate payment.
* `SCHEDULED`: Must be used when the payer user do a scheduled payment.

type_payment_priority.description: Indicate if this is a priority transaction or not.

agent_modality.description:
The agent modality of the withdraw.

* When the goal to be equal `CHANGE` or `WITHDRAW` this field is required.
* When the goal to be equal `BUY_OR_TRANSFER` you don't inform this field.

withdraw_ispb.description:
Withdrawal service provider ISPB.

* When the goal to be equal `CHANGE` or `WITHDRAW` this property is required.
* When the goal to be equal BUY_OR_TRANSFER you don't inform this field.

value_details.description:
The element group used to break down payment amounts

* If the goal to be equal `BUY_OR_TRANSFER` don't inform this field.
* If the goal to be equal `CHANGE` is mandatory inform two different
groups, one with the kind equal to `PURCHASE_AMOUNT` and another with
the kind equal to `AVAILABLE_CASH`.
* If the goal to be equal `WITHDRAW` is mandatory inform one group with
the kind equal to `AVAILABLE_CASH`.

kind.description:
The value kind.

* `PURCHASE_AMOUNT`: The purchase amount
* `AVAILABLE_CASH`: Value of the resource in kind provided.

value.description: The purchase value or the value of the resource in kind provided

key.description:
Key to identify the transactional account

* Don't provide this field when kind to be equal `MANUAL`.

conciliation_id.description:
Recipient conciliation identifier.

* When the kind to be equal `DYNAMIC_QRCODE`, `PAYER_QRCODE` or `PAYMENT_TRANSACTION_SERVICE` this field is mandatory.
* When the kind to be equal `STATIC_QRCODE` this field is optional.
* When the kind to be equal `MANUAL` OR 'KEY' don't inform this field.

end_to_end_id.description:
The payment's end to end id.

Required when kind is equal to KEY, DYNAMIC_QRCODE, STATIC_QRCODE or PAYER_QRCODE

anti_fraud_status.description:
The property indicates details about the anti-fraud analysis.

* `WITH_SUSPECT`: Anti-fraud engine has detected suspicion.
* `WITHOUT_SUSPECT`: Anti-fraud engine has not detected suspicion.

status.description:
The property indicates the status of the payment and should only be informed if the payment is `REJECTED` at its origin.

* `REJECTED`: Should create the payment as rejected
